meanings.definition: The lagging of an effect behind its cause, as when the change in magnetization of a ferromagnetic material lags behind the change in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The hysteresis in the magnetization of the material showed a delay in response to the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observed hysteresis in the magnetization of the metal, indicating a delay in its reaction to the magnetic field.
meanings.sent3: The hysteresis in the magnetization made the metal seem like a slowpoke compared to the magnetic field.
meanings.sent4: The hysteresis in the magnetization was like a hesitant dancer, always a step behind the music.
meanings.sent5: The hysteresis in the magnetization was so pronounced that it felt like watching a slow-motion movie of magnetic reactions.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which the value of a physical property lags behind changes in the effect causing it, as for instance when magnetic induction lags behind the magnetizing force.
meanings.sent1: The hysteresis in magnetic induction showed a delay in response to the magnetizing force.
meanings.sent2: The hysteresis in the property's value indicated a delay in its reaction to the effect causing it.
meanings.sent3: The hysteresis in magnetic induction made the experiment feel like a race between a tortoise and a hare.
meanings.sent4: The hysteresis in the property's value was like a shadow, always trailing behind the main action.
meanings.sent5: The hysteresis in magnetic induction was so evident that it felt like watching a time-delayed video of magnetic effects.
